action->Wild Empathy.name: Wild Empathy
action->Wild Empathy.description: The alicorn has an empathic connection to the creatures of the natural world that. The alicorn can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on animals and to make very simple @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of them.

action->Draw in Magic.name: Draw in Magic
action->Draw in Magic.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the alicorn Casts a Spell

Effect The alicorn attempts to counteract the triggering spell (counteract modifier +28, counteract rank 8th). If successful, the alicorn can choose to gain the effects of the triggering spell as its sole target.

action->Aerial Attack.name: Aerial Attack
action->Aerial Attack.description: The alicorn Flies and Strikes twice with their wings at any points during their movement. Each attack counts toward the alicorn's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after they make all the attacks.

action->Beam of Light.name: Beam of Light
action->Beam of Light.description: The alicorn harnesses a powerful burning ray of light from their horn. Creatures in a @Template[line|distance:120] take @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save). An unholy creature in the area takes an additional @Damage[8d6[spirit]] damage. If the light passes through an area of magical darkness or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, the beam attempts to counteract the darkness (counteract modifier +28, counteract rank 8th). The alicorn can't use its Beam of Light again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Beam of Light]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Ghost Touch.name: Ghost Touch
action->Ghost Touch.description: An alicorn's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

Almiraj.name: Almiraj
Almiraj.publicNotes:
An almiraj closely resembles a yellow hare in almost all ways... except for the 2-foot-long black horn jutting from its forehead. Though it shares this trait with the docile unicorn, that's where their similarities end. Almirajes are vicious creatures, known to slaughter much larger cattle and, in times of desperation, people. Its stare is said to send even the bravest warrior running for their life.

Unlike common hares, almirajes are solitary and intensely territorial. They're adaptable ambush hunters with the stamina and speed to chase down any prey. They attack with their jaws and claws but are primarily known for trying to gut their prey with a vicious stab from their horn. Many scholars believe that the terrifying magical aura the creatures exude originates from their horns. This line of thinking has led to an increase in almiraj attacks as local citizens try to capture the creature alive and remove the horn, hoping this will turn it into a more docile hare. These hopes have not proven fruitful, as an almiraj is just as aggressive, if not more so, after their horn has been removed.

Adventurers often think themselves lucky if they manage to avoid the terrifying horn of this ferocious predator, but it's a much better alternative than being caught in its jaws. Almirajes have a nasty habit of grabbing their prey and vigorously shaking them until they go limp. If this fails, they'll drag their prey underground until they suffocate deep in the earth. Few have ever escaped the burrow of an almiraj.

action->Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
action->Frightful Presence.description:
5 feet @Check[will|dc:22]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence] Creatures that critically fail are also fleeing for 1 round.

Apothecary Bee.name: Apothecary Bee
Apothecary Bee.publicNotes:
These giant bees feed on the nectar of medicinal herbs and magical flowers, naturally processing the liquid into syrupy-sweet potions. Depending on the precise diet of the apothecary bees, they can produce a wide variety of potions, storing any excess in the waxy cells lining their nest. Apothecary bee workers are about a foot long, with yellow and black stripes. While carrying a potion, the bee's abdomen visibly swells and often changes color to match the potion within.

The value of the apothecary bees' potions has led to numerous attempts at domestication, a dangerous, expensive dream with both high risks and high rewards. Once a magical garden has been established, apothecary beehives tend to become self-sustaining. Beekeepers can potentially guide their cultivation, but they're no longer necessary for the hive's survival. Some ancient, long-abandoned gardens still grow along the Sphinx River in Osirion, where many apothecary bees prowl for flowers that meet their standards. Upon their most recent dig to the surface, surki communities quickly began the process of "trading" with the bees, establishing habitats and using their natural magic sense to better tend the massive fields a large hive needs. Miflits, on the other hand, often end up absorbed into the bees' social structure.

The potions a hive produces vary from season to season, depending on what flowers are available. Beekeepers have made strides in creating gardens that yield specific potions and have even developed harvesting techniques that increase potion effectiveness. These techniques are valuable, closely guarded secrets, but even defective potions with cursed results have found use among the followers of Calistria and Norgorber.

consumable->Healing Potion (Moderate).name: Healing Potion (Moderate)
consumable->Healing Potion (Moderate).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(3d8+10)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Drain Potion.name: Drain Potion
action->Drain Potion.description:
Requirements The apothecary bee has no stored potions

Effect The apothecary bee slurps up a potion within its reach, storing it internally. A creature can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save to protect a potion in its possession.

action->Ingest Potion.name: Ingest Potion
action->Ingest Potion.description: The apothecary bee consumes the potion it has stored in its body. If the potion has the healing trait, the apothecary bee heals for the maximum amount.

action->Inject Potion.name: Inject Potion
action->Inject Potion.description: The apothecary bee injects its stored potion into a willing creature within its reach. This deals @Damage[1[piercing]] damage and grants the recipient the normal effects of drinking the potion.

action->Internal Cauldron.name: Internal Cauldron
action->Internal Cauldron.description: With an appropriate diet, an apothecary bee will create a potion of 6th level or lower every two weeks. Most often, this is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}. Each apothecary bee can store only one completed potion at a time. Unused potions can generally be harvested from an apothecary bee with a successful @Check[nature|dc:23] or @Check[survival|dc:23] check.

action->Potionsight.name: Potionsight
action->Potionsight.description: Apothecary bees' complex eyes let them see the auras of magical potions and instinctively identify potions of their level or lower. These auras are visible through mundane containers, though their eyes have no special ability to perceive or identify non-magical solutions, such as alchemical elixirs.

action->Smoke Susceptibility.name: Smoke Susceptibility
action->Smoke Susceptibility.description: An apothecary bee is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} if it starts its turn in heavy smoke.

action->Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
action->Dread Gaze.description:
Trigger A creature ends a move action within 30 feet of the ascendant griffon

Effect The ascendant griffon turns its head to stare down the triggering creature, and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} it. This use of Demoralize has the visual trait rather than the auditory trait, and the griffon does not take a penalty on its check for not sharing a language.

action->Carry Off.name: Carry Off
action->Carry Off.description: An ascendant griffon can Fly at full speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its talons, moving that creature along with it.

action->Disembowel.name: Disembowel
action->Disembowel.description:
Requirements The ascendant griffon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its talons

Effect The griffon makes a beak Strike to rip at the flesh of its prey. If the Strike hits, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or increases its drained value by 1, to a maximum of 4).

action->Razor-Edged Flight.name: Razor-Edged Flight
action->Razor-Edged Flight.description: The ascendant griffon glides violently forward, Flying twice. It makes a wing Strike at any point during the movement against up to two different targets; if either of these attacks is a critical hit, the target also takes 2d6 persistent bleed damage.

action->Spell Reflection.name: Spell Reflection
action->Spell Reflection.description:
Trigger An opponent casts a spell that targets the manticore and requires a saving throw

Effect The manticore gains a +4 circumstance bonus to the saving throw. If they critically succeed at the save, they can choose a creature within 30 feet that was not originally targeted by the spell. That creature becomes a new target of the spell, who must attempt its own save against the same DC.

Blooming Guardian.name: Blooming Guardian
Blooming Guardian.publicNotes: The pestilent blossoms adorning the antlers of a blooming guardian are most beautiful in moonlight, when they achieve full bloom and reveal their celestial glow. When blooming guardians near the end of their life cycle, they walk one final patrol of their forest as their ancient body decomposes into the understory.
Blooming Guardian.languagesDetails: speak with animals, speak with plants

action->Petal Form.name: Petal Form
action->Petal Form.description: The blooming guardian can dissipate momentarily into a swirling cloud of petals and pollen to pass over brambles and slip through cracks. When Striding in woodland terrain, the blooming guardian ignores difficult terrain and can pass through obstacles so long as there is a small passageway.

action->Budding Siphon.name: Budding Siphon
action->Budding Siphon.description: 20 feet. A blooming guardian is in a constant state of decomposition; to keep this entropy at bay, the flowers that cover their antlers continually siphon life from the surrounding area. All living creatures that enter or start their turn in the emanation take @Damage[6d4[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save). At the start of their turn in any round that the blooming guardian deals damage with siphoning buds, they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, plus 2 temporary Hit Points for each creature damaged beyond the first since the blooming guardian's last turn, to a maximum of 20 temporary Hit Points.

Carnotaurus.name: Carnotaurus
Carnotaurus.publicNotes: This 2,000-pound predator lives up to its name by ramming its prey with its distinctive horns lowered, knocking them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and viciously tearing into fallen victims before they can regain their footing. Do not let its size fool you; this massive dinosaur is deceptively quick when charging a potential meal. Aggressive and highly territorial, a carnotaurus will not hesitate to hunt down and slay any creature unlucky enough to cross its path.

action->Headbutt.name: Headbutt
action->Headbutt.description:
Trigger A creature ends a move action within reach of the carnotaurus's horn Strike

Effect The carnotaurus makes a horn Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
action->Powerful Charge.description: The carnotaurus lowers its horns and surges toward a foe. It Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to 2d12+9 and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if successful.

Chaos Falcon.name: Chaos Falcon
Chaos Falcon.publicNotes:
The extreme weather that gives birth to chaos falcons grants them a mix of abilities not found in other elemental birds. To them, lightning is as natural as fire and heat as comfortable as cold. The variability of their attacks makes them dangerous, even for the well prepared.

Like their elemental cousins, chaos falcons are often the harbingers of storms. They're also seen as omens of volcanic activity, as they will travel across great distances to play and dance in the resulting eruption. Between this association and their tendency to rain both fire and ice, their presence is considered dangerous by nearby settlements.

Fortunately, chaos falcons are solitary birds that prefer to stay away from the noise of civilization. They nest in volcanic vents or areas with geothermal activity, relying on the heat of the earth to incubate their eggs while hunting in the wilderness nearby. Unless their peace is disrupted or their safety threatened, they're unlikely to attack creatures that move through their habitat.

action->Storm Bolt.name: Storm Bolt
action->Storm Bolt.description: The chaos falcon's bolt Strike always deals the damage type of their storm nexus aura.

action->Stormsight.name: Stormsight
action->Stormsight.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair a chaos falcon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.

action->Dive-bomb.name: Dive-bomb
action->Dive-bomb.description:
Requirements The chaos falcon is Flying

Effect The chaos falcon Flies twice straight down. If they reach the ground or a similarly solid object at the end of this movement, their landing shatters that surface into sharp shards and droplets of molten stone deal @Damage[4d6[fire],3d8[piercing]]{4d6 fire and 3d8 piercing} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save) to all other creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet}.

action->Flash Storm.name: Flash Storm
action->Flash Storm.description: Water condenses around the ash particles in the chaos falcon's 15-foot aura, pelting everything beneath it with driving rain. Creatures in that area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:26] save or be pushed 20 feet down, falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if they start or end this movement on the ground.

action->Storm Nexus.name: Storm Nexus
action->Storm Nexus.description: 15 feet, @Damage[3d6[untyped]], @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save. The chaos falcon is surrounded by a cloud of volcanic ash, lightning arcing within the cloud as it glows hot in some areas and collects ice in others. A chaos falcon can change the damage type of this aura to cold, electricity, or fire as an action, which has the concentrate trait.

Concert Frog.name: Concert Frog
Concert Frog.publicNotes: These massive frogs store their eggs inside their stomach. When an egg hatches, the froglet crawls its way up into its parent's mouth to add its celebratory chirps and croaks to the family's song.

action->Conduct.name: Conduct
action->Conduct.description:
One of the froglets begins to sing, granting one of three effects to the concert frog and all allies within 60 feet until the beginning of the concert frog's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.I4C55X7AzchlF9FM]{Effect: Conduct}

  • Red Grants a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.
  • Blue Grants a +1 status bonus to AC and Fortitude saving throws.
  • Yellow Allies gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional @Damage[1d4[sonic]] damage on successful melee Strikes as their attacks resonate.

action->Three-Frog Orchestra.name: Three-Frog Orchestra
action->Three-Frog Orchestra.description: The concert frog has three froglets perched behind its lips, each of a different color. A creature can specifically target a froglet. If any froglets have died, the concert frog attempts a @Check[flat|dc:11] at the end of its turn; on a success, new froglets hatch in its stomach and emerge at the concert frog's lips.

Crying Cicada.name: Crying Cicada
Crying Cicada.publicNotes:
These small insects are a nuisance and danger to small villages within Brevoy, taking over entire forests and blending in with the foliage. Also known as calling beetles, due to their ability to mimic and repeat the voices of their previous victims, crying cicadas wait for passersby to lure into the trees, fascinating their victims with their cries before fluttering their wings to release toxic dust. Once a target is near death, crying cicadas will take flight from the trees and land on the body to feed.

The scale dust of crying cicadas can be turned into an effective ingested poison, but obtaining a cicada and harvesting these scales is so dangerous that most would-be poisoners simply die in the process. Even finding the insects is dangerous enough; crying cicadas' natural stealth and dark coloration make them difficult to locate among the trees of a forest, and following their cries often leads one to fall victim to the very creatures they're hunting.

The longer a colony of crying cicadas stays in a forest, the wider their collection of cries grows. Often, a young colony will be able to replicate only the sounds of small, dying creatures, but larger, more established colonies will have the ability to mimic the sounds of children and dragons.

action->Steal Voice.name: Steal Voice
action->Steal Voice.description:
Requirements An enemy creature has spoken since the crying cicada's last turn

Effect The crying cicada learns and mimics the sound of its opponent's voice. It can't make new sentences, but it can choose to repeat select parts of the phrases it has heard. All non-cicada creatures within 30 feet, other than the owner of the stolen voice, must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save to disbelieve the mimicry.

action->Wings Flat.name: Wings Flat
action->Wings Flat.description: When the crying cicada is still and perched on a tree, it blends seamlessly into the environment. It has an automatic result of 30 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as part of the tree.

action->Crying Cicada Poison.name: Crying Cicada Poison
action->Crying Cicada Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus slowed 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round).

action->Sob.name: Sob
action->Sob.description:
The crying cicada mimics the noise of a wounded animal or crying child. Non-cicada creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:150] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be distressed by the pleas for help. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the cicada uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Sob, that creature is temporarily immune to Sob for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature believes an animal or child needs help somewhere nearby. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or move closer to the cicada as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature is adjacent to the cicada, it stays still and doesn't act.

action->Wing Flurry.name: Wing Flurry
action->Wing Flurry.description: The crying cicada beats its wings together, exposing all creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:10] to crying cicada poison.

Decapod Dinghy.name: Decapod Dinghy
Decapod Dinghy.publicNotes:
Decapod dinghies are massive crabs indigenous to the Okaiyo Ocean that often assist the local humanoids with transportation. They can understand Thalassic and are instantly recognizable by the colorful anemones they carry on their backs and in their front claws. Athamarus and merfolk are common sights atop decapod dinghies, lounging comfortably amidst the anemones and sharing food with their hosts.

This peaceful cooperation is indirectly caused by the legendary crustacean Tehialai-Thief-Of-Ships. Since Tehialai's rampages are a constant threat in the Okaiyo, the ancestors of the decapod dinghies bonded with other marine life to survive. Decapod dinghies' relationship with anemones is particularly tight, using the small creatures as poisonous extensions of their own bodies and using their response to movements in the water to compensate for the decapod dinghy's otherwise poor vision. In a region wracked by Tehialai's storms, everyone needs to band together, after all.

action->All Aboard.name: All Aboard
action->All Aboard.description: A decapod dinghy can carry up to 30 Bulk of creatures or unattended items on their back, such as five Medium creatures. The anemones' gentle hold on the passengers is sufficient in most situations, but while in combat, those passengers are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} if they want to take other actions while remaining on the decapod dinghy's back.

action->Anemone Transport.name: Anemone Transport
action->Anemone Transport.description: The decapod dinghy and all their willing passengers teleport to a patch of anemones within 10 miles large enough for the decapod dinghy to stand among them. Although the decapod dinghy doesn't need to see the location, they must have been there before. All creatures transported are temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

action->Inflate Anemones.name: Inflate Anemones
action->Inflate Anemones.description: The anemones on the decapod dinghy's back inflate, enveloping all passengers and giving each passenger a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of the decapod dinghy's next turn.

action->Protect Passenger.name: Protect Passenger
action->Protect Passenger.description:
Trigger An enemy within 20 feet damages one of the decapod dinghy's passengers

Effect The decapod dinghy's anemones lash out for a tentacle Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Stinging Anemones.name: Stinging Anemones
action->Stinging Anemones.description: The decapod dinghy's anemones sting any number of creatures they choose among passengers and those the decapod dinghy has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The stings deal @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic]). On a failed save, that creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour.

action->Indomitable Beast.name: Indomitable Beast
action->Indomitable Beast.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The desert manticore is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The desert manticore avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, then can make a stinger Strike against a creature in its reach.

action->Manticore Venom.name: Manticore Venom
action->Manticore Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[5d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

action->Scorpion Sting.name: Scorpion Sting
action->Scorpion Sting.description: The desert manticore Strikes an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature with its stinger. The attack injects venom deeply, dealing an additional 4d8 poison damage and giving the target a –2 circumstance penalty to their initial save against the poison.

Drthak.name: Drthak
Drthak.publicNotes:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Drthaks are aquatic predators with long trailing fins that are rarely seen, clinging to coasts and estuaries where the high silt content makes them practically invisible to predators and prey alike. Some have been known to come inland, tracking their prey miles upriver before striking. The underwater environment alters the typical dischoran hunting behavior, with drthaks creating bubbles that implode to stun prey.

action->Auditory Hunter.name: Auditory Hunter
action->Auditory Hunter.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet uses an auditory action

Effect The drthak Strides or Swims towards the creature.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The drthak can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

action->Pull Under.name: Pull Under
action->Pull Under.description: The drthak can Swim at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws, carrying the creature along with it.

action->Sensitive Echolocation.name: Sensitive Echolocation
action->Sensitive Echolocation.description: The drthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the drthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

action->Bubble Burst.name: Bubble Burst
action->Bubble Burst.description:
Requirements The drthak is underwater

Effect The drthak uses sonic power to push aside water in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], which then collapses in a crushing torrent. All creatures in the area, other than the drthak, take @Damage[3d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save).

action->Resonant Jaws.name: Resonant Jaws
action->Resonant Jaws.description: When the drthak misses a screech Strike against a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its jaws, it deals that creature @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage.

Fangtooth School.name: Fangtooth School
Fangtooth School.publicNotes: The fearsome teeth of this fish are so massive that it's difficult for the creature to close its mouth. These fish must consider even much larger creatures as possible food, rising towards the surface during the darkness of night.
Fangtooth School.sensesDetails: low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 120 feet, wavesense (precise) 15 feet

action->Sunless Sight.name: Sunless Sight
action->Sunless Sight.description: While in bright light, the fangtooth fish school is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

action->Bite and Gnaw.name: Bite and Gnaw
action->Bite and Gnaw.description: Each enemy in the school's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save)

Flynkett.name: Flynkett
Flynkett.publicNotes:
The piercing whistle of the flynkett can often be heard over the harsh jungle rains, shrieking dissonantly when its cries combine with others of its pack. Although generally effective as a warning to nearby predators, these sharp cries also serve as a lure for reckless alchemists eager to study the creature's potent enzymes.

Flynketts' name, most theorize, is a corruption of "flinging kettle" or "flying kettle." They can't truly fly, instead using their skin flaps to glide in a manner similar to flying squirrels. However, the primary use of their skin flaps isn't for movement, but digestion. When it rains, flynketts roll up their loose skin, creating a crude sort of kettle in which to catch precipitation. The remarkable creatures' acid combines with the falling water to break down wood, soil, or even rocks into a nutritional stew. Therefore, the flynkett can flourish when introduced to any environment with frequent rain, something solid to stand on, and a lack of natural predators.

Although their acid can be harvested without harming a flynkett, the creatures rarely cooperate. If disturbed, particularly in the middle of feeding, they release clouds of acidic steam. They're also capable of spitting the fluid with deadly accuracy. Thankfully for those who run afoul of them, flynketts have no use for corpses and will generally break off pursuit when the interloper leaves their territory.

Several organizations and individual scholars have desperately sought to domesticate flynketts for use in alchemical production. To date, none of these efforts have been successful, though several abandoned labs still contain aggressive packs of flynketts who protect their new territory with ferocious tenacity.

action->Glide.name: Glide
action->Glide.description: The flynkett stretches its flaps to glide through the air. It moves 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air. The flynkett can remain in the air long as it spends at least 1 action Gliding each round and does not Kettle Up.

action->Kettle Up.name: Kettle Up
action->Kettle Up.description: The flynkett uses its skin flaps to form a crude kettle. While Kettled Up, the flynkett can't use its claw Strike or take move actions. If the flynkett has been Kettled Up for 1 minute or longer, and its kettle is full of water (usually due to the flynkett being in the rain), the flynkett's kettle begins to boil, emitting a piercing whistle that causes all creatures within 30 feet to take a –2 penalty to Perception checks to hear sources other than the flynkett; this is an auditory effect. The flynkett can stop Kettling Up as a free action.

action->Spill.name: Spill
action->Spill.description:
Requirements The flynkett is Kettled Up

Trigger The flynkett takes physical damage or is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The flynkett spills the contents of its full skin flaps, releasing its digestive juices in a cloud of acidic vapor that deals @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage to all non-flynkett creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save). If the flynkett was boiling, the damage is increased to @Damage[4d8[acid]].

Ghost Ape.name: Ghost Ape
Ghost Ape.publicNotes: Ghost apes are reclusive and territorial creatures that usually reveal themselves only when their homes are threatened. Most ghost apes will first attempt to use their imposing presence and natural teleportation to frighten and confuse their foes into fleeing. Ghost apes can speak but aren't particularly talkative, though they will, on rare occasions, treat with those who approach them with respect. Ghost apes can be powerful allies when motivated by a common cause, although they tend to be suspicious of outsiders, and their trust isn't easily earned.

action->Phantom Step.name: Phantom Step
action->Phantom Step.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ghost ape moves quickly, passing through the Ethereal Plane. They teleport up to a distance equal to twice their Speed within their line of sight.

action->Ghost Stance.name: Ghost Stance
action->Ghost Stance.description: The ghost ape phases partially out of existence, its form blurring and becoming difficult to pinpoint. While in this stance, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to any creature that isn't adjacent to them. They can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. They also gain resistance 5 to physical damage. If the ghost ape takes force damage, this stance ends and they can't reenter it for [[/br 1d3 #rounds]]{1d3 rounds}.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The giant coppermouth can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action->Greater Electrolocation.name: Greater Electrolocation
action->Greater Electrolocation.description: A giant coppermouth can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

action->Coppermouth Venom.name: Coppermouth Venom
action->Coppermouth Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison],1d6[electricity]]{1d6 poison and 1d6 electricity} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison],1d6[electricity]]{2d6 poison and 1d6 electricity} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison],2d6[electricity]]{2d6 poison and 2d6 electricity} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}

action->Quickening Jolt.name: Quickening Jolt
action->Quickening Jolt.description: The coppermouth manipulates its own nervous system by increasing its reaction time, Striding and making two Strikes against different targets during the movement. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made both attacks.

action->Venomous Spit.name: Venomous Spit
action->Venomous Spit.description: The coppermouth unleashes a stream of electrified venom in a @Template[line|distance:30]. The venom deals @Damage[8d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]) and creatures that take damage from the venom are immediately exposed to coppermouth venom. The copper mouth can't use Venomous Spit again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Giant Fangtooth.name: Giant Fangtooth
Giant Fangtooth.publicNotes: A single bite from this creature's signature fangs can cause death by blood loss within minutes; what's worse, the giant fangtooth is willing to attack creatures far larger than itself.
Giant Fangtooth.sensesDetails: low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 120 feet, wavesense (precise) 30 feet

action->Sunless Sight.name: Sunless Sight
action->Sunless Sight.description: In an area of bright light, the giant fangtooth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

action->Deep Puncture.name: Deep Puncture
action->Deep Puncture.description: Creatures critically hit by the fangtooth's bite take an additional 1d8 persistent bleed damage.

action->Eyespots.name: Eyespots
action->Eyespots.description: A giant tardigrade can't see anything beyond 30 feet.

action->Tun State.name: Tun State
action->Tun State.description:
Trigger The tardigrade would be reduced to 0 Hit Points or would die due to starvation, suffocation, or similar environmental causes

Frequency once per week

Requirements The tardigrade isn't already in tun state

Effect The giant tardigrade doesn't die but instead remains at 1 Hit Point and curls into a dry ball, called a tun. While in this tun state, the giant tardigrade is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, doesn't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and doubles its resistance to 20. It remains in tun state indefinitely until covered in significant amounts of water, at which point it begins to rehydrate, gaining regeneration 5. The regeneration persists until it reaches maximum Hit Points. The giant tardigrade then exits its tun state.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: The goblin shark's coloration blends in with the water. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check while underwater.

action->Electrolocation.name: Electrolocation
action->Electrolocation.description: A goblin shark can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet.

action->Grasping Jaws.name: Grasping Jaws
action->Grasping Jaws.description: Creatures that successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} from the goblin shark's jaws take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] as the shark's hold tears flesh away.

action->Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
action->Lunging Bite.description: The goblin shark dashes forward and extends its jaws bite a creature. It swims up to 10 feet in a straight line and makes a jaws Strike with a reach of 10 feet.

action->Three-Headed.name: Three-Headed
action->Three-Headed.description: Any ability that would sever a greater chimera's head (such as a critical hit with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill a chimera (as long as it has at least one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using any abilities granted by the head.

action->Multiple Reactions.name: Multiple Reactions
action->Multiple Reactions.description: A greater chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

action->Three-Headed Strike.name: Three-Headed Strike
action->Three-Headed Strike.description: The greater chimera makes a Strike with each of its heads, each at a –2 penalty and targeting a different creature. These Strikes count as only one attack for the greater chimera's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A harbor seal can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action->Whisker Sense.name: Whisker Sense
action->Whisker Sense.description: A harbor seal can use its whiskers to sense vibrations as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

action->Burrowing Retreat.name: Burrowing Retreat
action->Burrowing Retreat.description:
Trigger The hardhead mole is hit by a Strike

Effect The hardhead mole immediately Burrows to a burrow hole if there is one within 20 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Shovel Earth.name: Shovel Earth
action->Shovel Earth.description: The hardhead mole leaves a burrow hole in its square or an adjacent square. The square becomes difficult terrain but can be flattened back into normal terrain with an Interact action.

action->Unbalancing Burrow.name: Unbalancing Burrow
action->Unbalancing Burrow.description: The hardhead mole Burrows up to 20 feet in a straight line, displacing the earth on the surface. Any creature it passes through takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. This creates a burrow hole at the beginning and end of the line.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: The helicoprion can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Deshell.name: Deshell
action->Deshell.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the helicoprion's jaws

Effect The shark rips into the creature dealing @Damage[3d10[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

strike-ranged->Hexbolt.name: Hexbolt
strike-ranged->Hexbolt.description: Damage type is the immunity the Hexmoth has.

action->Arcanosense.name: Arcanosense
action->Arcanosense.description: A hexmoth can sense sources of magic at the listed range as though it has a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} constant innate spell.

action->Advanced Arcanovore.name: Advanced Arcanovore
action->Advanced Arcanovore.description: A hexmoth has resistance 10 against all damage caused by spells. It's immune to one type of energy it consumed most as a hexworm, typically acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic.

action->Arcanosense.name: Arcanosense
action->Arcanosense.description: A hexworm can sense sources of magic at the listed range as though it has a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} constant innate spell.

action->Arcanovore.name: Arcanovore
action->Arcanovore.description: A hexworm has resistance 5 against all damage caused by spells.

action->Arcane Consumption.name: Arcane Consumption
action->Arcane Consumption.description: The hexworm attempts to consume the magic of an adjacent magical effect or unattended magic item. It attempts a counteract check against the target with a +11 modifier. On a success, the magical effect ends. A magic item instead becomes a mundane item for 1 round. The hexworm gains @Damage[2d8[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Arcanotaxis.name: Arcanotaxis
action->Arcanotaxis.description:
Requirements The hexworm has detected a source of magic with its arcanosense

Trigger The hexworm's turn begins

Effect The hexworm Strides up to its Speed toward the nearest source of magic it can detect.

action->Hold Tight.name: Hold Tight
action->Hold Tight.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the holdfast's jaws takes damage from another creature's Strike

Effect The holdfast Constricts the creature in its jaws.

action->Lithe.name: Lithe
action->Lithe.description: A holdfast treats any tight space it can barely fit its head in or wider as difficult terrain and doesn't need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} to move through it.

action->Burst from Below.name: Burst from Below
action->Burst from Below.description: The holdfast Burrows and then Strikes. If the holdfast began this movement @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

action->Crush Throat.name: Crush Throat
action->Crush Throat.description: When a creature fails a save against the holdfast's Constrict, the creature's throat is held tight, stopping them from speaking as long as they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. This prevents the creature from casting spells with vocal incantations, as well as from using many sonic or auditory abilities.

action->Flexible Dodge.name: Flexible Dodge
action->Flexible Dodge.description:
Requirements The hooplamander is Unfurled

Trigger The hooplamander is targeted by a Strike

Effect The hooplamander gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack and enters its Wheels Up stance.

action->Fearless Rush.name: Fearless Rush
action->Fearless Rush.description:
Trigger The karkadann becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}

Effect The karkadann reduces their frightened value by 1 (to a minimum of 0). The karkadann then Strides toward an enemy.

action->Ghost Touch.name: Ghost Touch
action->Ghost Touch.description: A karkadann's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A leopard seal can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action->Protective Blubber.name: Protective Blubber
action->Protective Blubber.description: A leopard seal treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).

action->Whisker Sense.name: Whisker Sense
action->Whisker Sense.description: A leopard seal can use its whiskers to sense vibrations as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The lightning turtle can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action->Greater Electrolocation.name: Greater Electrolocation
action->Greater Electrolocation.description: A lightning turtle can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

action->Shell Shock.name: Shell Shock
action->Shell Shock.description:
Trigger A lightning turtle is hit by a melee or an unarmed attack

Effect The lightning turtle releases some of its stored electrical power, inflicting @Damage[7d6[electricity]] damage to the creature attacking it.

action->Healing Pulse.name: Healing Pulse
action->Healing Pulse.description: The lightning turtle releases a pulse of low-intensity electricity from its body to promote healing. This restores @Damage[5d8[healing]] Hit Points to the turtle and each living ally within 10 feet, including creatures normally immune to electricity. The turtle can't use Healing Pulse again for 1 minute and is temporarily immune to the Healing Pulse of any lightning turtle for 1 minute.

action->Sparking Shell.name: Sparking Shell
action->Sparking Shell.description: The lightning turtle withdraws into its shell. This increases its AC to 36, but it can't act except to use Shell Shock or reemerge as a single action. While in its shell, the turtle's Shell Shock deals another 4d6 damage and loses the nonlethal trait.

action->Metal Allergy.name: Metal Allergy
action->Metal Allergy.description: When a magnegor takes damage from a metal weapon or an effect with the metal trait, it takes @Damage[5[untyped]] additional damage and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The value of the sickened condition increases each time the magnegor fails such a check, to a maximum of 3.

action->Excavating Spines.name: Excavating Spines
action->Excavating Spines.description: The magnegor inadvertently digs a 10-foot-deep continuous trench in any square it Wallows through, as long as the ground in that space isn't made of stone, rock, or some other surface too hard to excavate. The trench is greater difficult terrain. At the GM's discretion, any excavated square can reveal a deposit of sedimentary rock filled with metal ore that has Hardness 7 and 28 Hit Points.

action->Magnetized Coat.name: Magnetized Coat
action->Magnetized Coat.description: When a magnegor comes within 30 feet of a metal object or a deposit of metal ore, its thousands of wiry hairs stand on end, pointing towards the metal and creating a magnetic field. Metal items of light or negligible Bulk that touch the magnegor's coat adhere to it magnetically, requiring an Interact action to be pried free. Creatures wearing or primarily composed of metal treat all squares in a 10-foot radius around the magnegor as difficult terrain, unless they are moving directly towards it.

action->Wallow.name: Wallow
action->Wallow.description:
Requirements The magnegor is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

Effect The magnegor rolls on its spine-covered back, up to its Speed, furrowing the earth and crushing any Large or smaller creatures in its path. This deals @Damage[4d10[piercing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save; on a failed save, a creature wearing metal armor or made of metal is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the magnegor's magnetized coat (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 24). For each metal object or piece of equipment a restrained creature chooses to leave stuck to the magnegor, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its attempts to Escape. A creature that relinquishes all its metal Escapes automatically. The magnegor can move at its full Speed while it has a creature restrained in this way, bringing the creature along.

action->Greater Electrolocation.name: Greater Electrolocation
action->Greater Electrolocation.description: A magnetic gecko can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an electricity effect within the last minute.

action->Uncanny Climber.name: Uncanny Climber
action->Uncanny Climber.description: A magnetic gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a gecko attempts an Athletics check to Climb and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.

Majungasaurus.name: Majungasaurus
Majungasaurus.publicNotes: The majungasaurus prowls in a crouched posture, carrying its bulk so low to the ground it is eye-to-eye with its prey. Unlike most carnivorous dinosaurs, the majungasaurus is primarily an ambush predator, patiently lying in wait for quarry to come within reach before bursting from cover with a signature cry to attack.

Mammoth Land Star.name: Mammoth Land Star
Mammoth Land Star.hpDetails: regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 for each missing limb); limb regrowth

action->Regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 fo.name: Regeneration 20 (reduced by 4 for each missing limb)

action->Limb Regrowth.name: Limb Regrowth
action->Limb Regrowth.description:
A healthy mammoth land star typically has five limbs. A creature can sever a limb by targeting it and dealing damage equal to the limb's Hit Points. The mammoth land star can regrow a missing limb over the course of 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Dby3ecpqPheBrgnT]{Effect: Mammoth Land Star Limbs}

action->Regrowth.name: Regrowth
action->Regrowth.description: Whenever a limb is severed, it must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5]. On a success, the limb will slowly begin to grow into a new mammoth land star over the course of a week, unless it is doused in acid or fire.

action->Detach.name: Detach
action->Detach.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star falls below half its total Hit Points

Effect The mammoth land star severs one of its own limbs as a distraction, then Strides three times. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Digest.name: Digest
action->Digest.description:
Requirements The mammoth land star has a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mammoth land star extrudes its stomach onto its prey and digests it alive. The target takes @Damage[(2d12+6)[acid]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

action->Glide.name: Glide
action->Glide.description: The land star blows air through its feet to hover 1 foot in the air and Strides twice with a +5-foot circumstance bonus to Speed, ignoring uneven ground and difficult terrain below it.

action->Goldsense.name: Goldsense
action->Goldsense.description: Marps can sense any accumulation of gold within range. They also can precisely measure the purity of gold by touch.

action->Panicked Withdrawal.name: Panicked Withdrawal
action->Panicked Withdrawal.description:
Trigger The marp takes damage from a melee Strike

Effect The marp drops any items held in their hands, then Climbs or Strides up to 15 feet.

action->Gold?.name: Gold?
action->Gold?.description:
The marp asks for gold from all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Each target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save or retrieve and drop gold valuables as a free action.

Critical Success The target can refuse the request, though they can also choose to willingly hand over any amount of gold. If they do so, they gain a +1 status bonus to the next saving throw they attempt within 1 minute, and they're temporarily immune to Scampering Theft for 1 minute.

Success The target can refuse the request.

Failure The target must drop coins, gold jewelry, or other objects worth 20 gp.

Critical Failure As failure, but 40 gp.

action->Scampering Theft.name: Scampering Theft
action->Scampering Theft.description:
The marp runs and attempts to snatch a purse, pendant, or other such object. The marp Strides up to their Speed, and they can move through enemy spaces during this movement. They then attempt to steal valuables from the target, who must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save.

Success The marp fails to steal anything from the target.

Failure The marp steals one object from the target's possession that is made of or contains gold. They can't steal objects held by or permanently attached to the creature. If the object contains lead, the marp drops it at the target's feet. After stealing the object (or dropping it), the marp then Strides up to their Speed.

action->Visage Strike.name: Visage Strike
action->Visage Strike.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the mirror wolf's visages damages mirror wolf's ally

Effect The mirror wolf teleports to the visage's spot, destroying the visage, and makes a jaws Strike.

action->Bond with Mortal.name: Bond with Mortal
action->Bond with Mortal.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide spends 10 minutes to form a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 14, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane. The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunity to disease, paralysis, and poison, along with their resistance to all damage, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate amount of physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.

Mist Bear.name: Mist Bear
Mist Bear.publicNotes:
Like the mundane bears they resemble, a mist bear is motivated by simple pursuits, such as food. Unlike other ursines, the mist bear can dissipate into a cloud of ethereal vapor, greatly complicating the efforts of neighboring humanoids to keep their provisions safe from the creature's depredations.

Fortunately, the mist bear follows a predictable pattern of behavior, usually foraging within the Universe for only a few months every year to gorge itself. Once sated, it then enters a state similar to hibernation where it drifts through the Ethereal Plane as a cloud of intangible vapor.

action->Mist Form.name: Mist Form
action->Mist Form.description: Over the course of a minute, a mist bear can transmute its form into a cloud of ethereal vapor. In this state it has resistance 10 to physical damage, is immune to precision damage, and can't use any actions with the attack or manipulate trait. It has a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. The mist bear can return to solid form as a single action.

action->Orescent.name: Orescent
action->Orescent.description: A mjolgat can detect the ores of unrefined precious metals with its powerful nose. Common earth and stone do not impede the mjolgat from smelling ores deep within the ground.

action->Head On.name: Head On
action->Head On.description:
Trigger A creature the mjolgat can see targets the mjolgat with an attack

Effect The mjolgat swings its crest in the direction of the danger, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Uncanny Mimicry.name: Uncanny Mimicry
action->Uncanny Mimicry.description: While unable to communicate for prolonged periods, a mocking chorus can precisely imitate a humanoid voice. If a creature speaks within audible range of the mocking chorus, the mocking chorus can speak using the creature's voice, even if it says different words than what were spoken. Creatures that hear the mocking chorus speak this way can attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save to recognize the source. On a success, creatures gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against the mocking chorus' abilities for 1 minute.

Morthak.name: Morthak
Morthak.publicNotes:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Morthaks, being low, squat, and flat, resemble a crocodile rebuilt to dig like a mole. At home beneath vast meadows and plains, the only sign of their passing are the earthen mounds they leave behind when they emerge to hunt. Those who encounter them in the wild speak of the sub-aural rumble they produce as they disintegrate the earth with sonic blasts, a sound that's felt rather than heard.

action->Sensitive Echolocation.name: Sensitive Echolocation
action->Sensitive Echolocation.description: The morthak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the morthak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

action->Auditory Swipe.name: Auditory Swipe
action->Auditory Swipe.description:
Trigger A creature within the morthak's reach uses an auditory action

Effect The morthak makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Shattering Scrape.name: Shattering Scrape
action->Shattering Scrape.description: The morthak makes a claw Strike against a creature wearing stone or metal armor. If the Strike hits and the armor's Hardness is 12 or lower, that armor is broken.

action->Spectral Mount.name: Spectral Mount
action->Spectral Mount.description: A pale horse can accept a corporeal rider, but such a rider is left behind if the pale horse passes through a creature or object.

action->Aura of Despair.name: Aura of Despair
action->Aura of Despair.description: 30 feet. A living creature that begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. A creature is temporarily immune to the aura for 1 hour if it critically succeeds.

action->Crumbling Earth.name: Crumbling Earth
action->Crumbling Earth.description: The plated python lets its breath sink into the ground, transforming it to brittle stone within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. The stone is difficult terrain to all other creatures. Other creatures on the ground in this area when it transforms must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as the stone beneath them crumbles to rubble. A creature immobilized in this way can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} normally or use three total Interact actions to dig themself free.

action->Petrify Prey.name: Petrify Prey
action->Petrify Prey.description:
Requirements The plated python has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Trigger The plated python begins its turn

Effect The python's breath seeps into the grabbed creature. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature's body hardens and stiffens, causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 round and Swallowed Whole.

Critical Failure The creature is petrified permanently and Swallowed Whole.

action->Stone Tunnel.name: Stone Tunnel
action->Stone Tunnel.description: When a plated python burrows through ground, it petrifies and destroys the material in front of it, leaving a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake. A plated python doesn't need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} to pass through any space at least that wide.

action->Swallow Whole.name: Swallow Whole
action->Swallow Whole.description:
Large, @Damage[(3d10+5)[acid]], Rupture 20

This damage ignores the hardness of petrified creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Towering Bite.name: Towering Bite
action->Towering Bite.description: The plated python lunges to its full length, making a jaws Strike with a reach of 60 feet. If the Strike hits, its target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and pulled to an empty space adjacent to the plated python. The python can attack through any material it can burrow through, leaving a stone tunnel as normal.

Protoceratops.name: Protoceratops
Protoceratops.publicNotes: Though it lacks the distinctive horns of its larger relative the triceratops, the protoceratops is more than capable of holding its own in combat, using its tail to knock enemies to the ground and its sturdy frill to turn away blows.

action->Defensive Posture.name: Defensive Posture
action->Defensive Posture.description: The protoceratops tucks in its head and presents its sturdy frill, granting a +1 circumstance bonus to AC adjacent allies. The protoceratops remains in its Defensive Posture until the start of its next turn, but only grants the bonus while allies remain adjacent

action->Frill Block.name: Frill Block
action->Frill Block.description:
Requirements The protoceratops is in its Defensive Posture

Trigger An adjacent ally would take damage from a physical attack

Effect The protoceratops partially blocks the blow with its frill, reducing the damage by 5.

Rift Chameleon.name: Rift Chameleon
Rift Chameleon.publicNotes: Rift chameleons are best known for their unsettling ability to swallow creatures significantly larger than themselves, thanks to a digestive tract that connects to its own pocket of the Ethereal Plane. When two or more rift chameleons remain in proximity for extended periods of time, their partially extradimensional nature begins to subtly warp the surrounding terrain. Direction and distance become confused to all but the lizards, making it easy for locals to get lost in places they once thought familiar.

action->Extradimensional Gullet.name: Extradimensional Gullet
action->Extradimensional Gullet.description: The rift chameleon's innards exist partially on the Ethereal Plane, allowing it to swallow any number of creatures, even ones larger than itself. Creatures that @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or cut themselves free from the chameleon's stomach reappear in the Universe adjacent to the rift chameleon's position. Creatures cannot escape from the rift chameleon's gullet using teleportation effects unless those effects can also cross planar boundaries.

action->Flickering Dash.name: Flickering Dash
action->Flickering Dash.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rift chameleon Strides twice. During this movement, it flits quickly between the Universe and the Ethereal Plane, gaining resistance 5 to physical damage.

Royal Basilisk.name: Royal Basilisk
Royal Basilisk.publicNotes: The royal basilisk is aptly named, not for only the metal crown upon its head but also for the unique potency of its poison. The creature's poison manifests as a sort of cloying vapor that sticks onto and eats away at anything it touches. Their mastery of poison does appear to come at a cost, as the royal basilisk has no ability to petrify its prey. Although the royal basilisk can painstakingly shape a crown, some made of simple iron and others of rare skymetals, they much prefer to collect crowns crafted by other creatures.

action->Crowned Royalty.name: Crowned Royalty
action->Crowned Royalty.description: The royal basilisk's crown is firmly attached to its head but can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarmed} as though it were a held item. Without a crown, the royal basilisk's mastery over poison is weakened enough that it loses its miasmatic shroud. The royal basilisk can equip a crown within its tail's reach as an Interact action. A royal basilisk's crown is normally made of iron and enables the basilisk to use miasmatic shroud, but crowns made of other, more exotic materials might confer different abilities.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A rumindrol can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Dreadful Resonance.name: Dreadful Resonance
action->Dreadful Resonance.description: 60 feet. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) and take @Damage[3d8[sonic]] damage.

action->Junk Nest.name: Junk Nest
action->Junk Nest.description: The scroungefeather's nest of sharp metallic junk covers a 15-foot-by-15-foot area. The area is difficult terrain and hazardous terrain to any non-scroungefeather creatures. A creature that moves on the ground through the nest takes @Damage[3[piercing]] damage for each square of the area it moves into. Scroungefeathers can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} at any point in the nest.

action->Tossed Scraps.name: Tossed Scraps
action->Tossed Scraps.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather has Grabbed Debris

Effect The scroungefeather flings the debris at a target within 20 feet, making an attack roll with a +12 modifier. On a success, the target takes @Damage[(2d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Grab Debris.name: Grab Debris
action->Grab Debris.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather is in its nest or another environment rich with debris

Effect The scroungefeather uses an Interact action to grab an item with its beak, selected randomly; roll 1d4 to determine the type of debris. The scroungefeather gains access to the listed abilities until it uses Tossed Scraps to discard the debris or until it Releases the debris. The scroungefeather can't use its beak attack while it is using its beak to Grab Debris.

d4ItemEffect
1Armor scrapThe scroungefeather gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC.
2Shattered bladeThe scroungefeather gains a broken blade melee Strike with a +12 attack modifier that deals 2d10+6 slashing damage.
3Unexploded bombWhen the scroungefeather throws this with Tossed Scraps, all the damage is fire damage, and the bomb also deals 3 fire splash damage.
4Faulty wandThe scroungefeather gains a magic bolt ranged Strike witha +14 attack modifier that deals 2d6+6 force damage.

action->Empathic Communication.name: Empathic Communication
action->Empathic Communication.description: While a shotalashu can't speak, even telepathically, it understands simple commands in the languages it knows. It returns telepathic sensations of emotion to creatures touching it or the partner of its telepathic link at any distance.

action->Telepathic Link.name: Telepathic Link
action->Telepathic Link.description: A rider who would tame a shotalashu for a mount must first form a telepathic link with it. Establishing this link require spending a week with the desired mount and succeeding at a @Check[occultism|dc:21] check. Any creature with telepathic capabilities, such as telepathy, touch telepathy, empathic sense, or the ability to cast spells such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HqTI6wRrck1YXp3F]{Telepathy}, gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. This link remains and neither can form a new link until one member dies. The shock of a partner dying leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for at least a month.

action->Jungle Stride.name: Jungle Stride
action->Jungle Stride.description: The shotalashu ignores difficult terrain due to vegetation.

action->Telepathic Pounce.name: Telepathic Pounce
action->Telepathic Pounce.description:
The shotalashu hunts by pinning its foes with its mind. One creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a –5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round.

Failure The creature takes a –10 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round. The shotalashu can then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for one round. The shotalashu can Leap.

action->Transparency.name: Transparency
action->Transparency.description: Unless it has fed recently, the sky fisher is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. Using non-hostile actions does not cause the sky fisher to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. When it takes a hostile action of any kind, the sky fisher is hidden instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} until the start of its next turn, as the vague outline of its many tendrils temporarily becomes faintly visible.

action->Abduct.name: Abduct
action->Abduct.description: The sky fisher reels in a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by its tentacles, pulling them into an adjacent space, and then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow them Whole} (Large, @Damage[(3d8+12)[acid]], Rupture 25). The sky fisher can only use Swallow Whole when using Abduct.

action->Enzymic Vent.name: Enzymic Vent
action->Enzymic Vent.description: The sky fisher vents flesh-eating enzymes into the air, dealing @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid],3d6[bleed]]{3d6 persistent acid damage and 3d6 persistent bleed damage} in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). It can't use Enzymic Vent again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Enzymic Vent]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Jet.name: Jet
action->Jet.description: The sky fisher quickly expels some of its gases to move swiftly through the air, Flying up to 100 feet in a straight line; this movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Sky Fisher Venom.name: Sky Fisher Venom
action->Sky Fisher Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and can't speak above a whisper (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and can't speak (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Soniphak.name: Soniphak
Soniphak.publicNotes:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Often mistaken for drakes, soniphaks glide above rocky or barren ground, picking out prey with their hearing. A hunting soniphak disables its targets with concentrated bursts of sound before snatching them up and feasting on the move. Despite being able to speak, soniphaks are no more social than other dischorans, generally responding to even the quietest attempts at communication with destructive shouting.

action->Sensitive Echolocation.name: Sensitive Echolocation
action->Sensitive Echolocation.description: The soniphak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the soniphak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

action->Snatch.name: Snatch
action->Snatch.description: The soniphak can Fly at half Speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claws, carrying that creature along with it.

action->Aftershock.name: Aftershock
action->Aftershock.description: Whenever a soniphak hits with a screech Strike, feedback deals each creature the soniphak has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage.

action->Disruptive Screech.name: Disruptive Screech
action->Disruptive Screech.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the soniphak uses an auditory action

Effect The soniphak makes a screech Strike against the triggering creature. This disrupts a triggering concentrate action if the Strike is a critical hit.

action->Shattering Scream.name: Shattering Scream
action->Shattering Scream.description: The soniphak can focus its screech at a stone or rock surface within 60 feet to create an explosion in a @Template[burst|distance:15] from the point of impact. Creatures in the area take @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain due to fragments of loose stone.

Sporeback Frog.name: Sporeback Frog
Sporeback Frog.publicNotes: This burrowing frog digs itself into moist earth so poisonous moss and toxic mushrooms can grow on its body.

action->Seed Spores.name: Seed Spores
action->Seed Spores.description: A creature hit by the sporeback frog's tongue Strike takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] damage as fungal spores begin to grow.

action->Soporific Spores.name: Soporific Spores
action->Soporific Spores.description: The sporeback frog shakes the plants and fungi on its back until they emit a cloud of spores in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. All creatures in the area must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure). This ability can't be used again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Soporific Spores]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Skymetal Metamorphosis.name: Skymetal Metamorphosis
action->Skymetal Metamorphosis.description:
Each stargut hydra has at least one metamorphosis resulting from consuming a specific skymetal and internalizing its properties. If you give a stargut hydra more than one metamorphosis, you should consider increasing its level and changing its statistics.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.Bds5RP9grJxhZALW]{Adamantine} The stargut hydra's Strikes bypass Hardness and are treated as adamantine. The stargut hydra gains resistance 10 to physical damage (except adamantine).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.lFRU108HnGlnMwqS]{Abysium} (aura, poison) The stargut hydra emits an aura of nauseating radiation from the abysium in its body. Any creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the stargut hydra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.N4l6y6v9pKy8Nj5i]{Djezet} (magical) The stargut hydra gains a +2 status bonus to saves against magic.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5bRdhgghjtWF1Vuu]{Inubrix} The stargut hydra's Strikes ignore resistance to damage from metal armor's armor specialization effects and do not trigger the Shield Block reaction or reactions from armor property runes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.sTlptNnUX2eA0DIH]{Noqual} The stargut hydra's Strikes and abilities gain a +2 status bonus to damage against creatures with the ability to Cast a Spell.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.6Z0v9Tsthm9hyzb3]{Orichalcum} When the stargut hydra has only two heads remaining, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. It can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.SXJRjw4R8m7NPDGc]{Siccatite} After the stargut hydra takes fire damage, it becomes superheated, gaining immunity to fire and weakness 10 to cold. While superheated, cold damage can be used to cauterize a stump. After the stargut hydra takes cold damage, it becomes chilled, gaining immunity to cold and weakness 10 to fire.

Stonefish.name: Stonefish
Stonefish.publicNotes: Stonefish use their superior camouflage to lie in wait and devour small prey, becoming indistinguishable from the reefs they call home. Larger creatures are also at risk, although mostly through accidental contact with the stonefish's spines and their agonizing venom.

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: The stonefish can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in its natural environment even if it doesn't have cover.

action->Defensive Spines.name: Defensive Spines
action->Defensive Spines.description: When a creature moves into a space with one or more stonefish, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish venom.

action->Stonefish Venom.name: Stonefish Venom
action->Stonefish Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 3 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and clumsy 2 (1 hour)

Stonefish Swarm.name: Stonefish Swarm
Stonefish Swarm.publicNotes: Stonefish occasionally band together where food is abundant, filling all nooks and crannies of a coral reef. In large numbers, stonefish can take on prey much larger than themselves.

action->Defensive Spines.name: Defensive Spines
